name: Bauchi
description: Bauchi (earlier Yakoba) is a city in northeast Nigeria, the capital of Bauchi State, of the Bauchi Local Government Area within that State, and of the traditional Bauchi Emirate

name: Tafawa Balewa
description: Tafawa Balewa is a local government area in the Southern part of Bauchi State in northern Nigeria. Its headquarters is in the town of Tafawa Balewa

name: Dass
description: Dass is a Local Government Area of Bauchi State, Nigeria. Its headquarters are in the town of Dass.

name: Toro
description: Toro is a Local Government Area of Bauchi State, Nigeria. Toro local government headquarters is in the town of Toro

name: Bogoro
description: Bogoro is a Local Government Area of Bauchi State, Nigeria. Its headquarters are in the town of Bogoro. Za’ar or Sayawa people are the majority of its inhabitants

name: Ningi
description: Ningi is a town, a local government area, and an emirate in Bauchi State, Nigeria. The Ningi emirate comprises two local government areas, Ningi and Warji, with a combined area of 5,250 km2 and a population of 501,912 according to the 2006 Census

name: Warji
description: Warji is a Local Government Area of Bauchi State, Nigeria. Its headquarters is in the town of Warji.

name: Ganjuwa
description: Ganjuwa is a Local Government Area of Bauchi State, Nigeria. It was curved out from the Darazo Local Government in September, 1991 and it's bordered with Jigawa State from the North and Gombe State from the South Eas

name: Kirfi
description: Kirfi is a Local Government Area of Bauchi State, Nigeria, bordering Gombe State in the east. Its headquarters are in the town of Kirfi (or Kirfin Kasa). The northeasterly line of equal latitude and longitude passes through the LGA.

name: Alkaleri
description: Alkaleri is a Local Government Area of Bauchi State, Nigeria. Its headquarters are in the town of Alkaleri (or Alkalere) on the A345 highway in the north of the area at10°15′58″N 10°20′07″E. The northeasterly line of equal latitude and longitude passes through the LGA.

name: Darazo
description: Darazo is a Local Government Area of Bauchi State, Nigeria. Its headquarters are in the town of Darazo.

name: Misau
description: Misau is a Local Government Area of Bauchi State, Nigeria. Its headquarters are in the town of Misau. It was founded by Hamman Mangan who ruled as an unofficial King for a period of 25 years at around 1850 AD.

name: Giade
description: Giade is a Local Government Area of Bauchi State, Nigeria. Its headquarters are in the town of Giade.

name: Shira
description: Shira is a Local Government Area of Bauchi State, Nigeria. Its headquarters is in the town of Yana.

name: Jama'are
description: Jama'are is a Local Government Area of Bauchi State, Nigeria. Its headquarters are in the town of Jama'are.

name: Katagum
description: Katagum is a town, a local government area and a traditional emirate in Bauchi State of northern Nigeria

name: Itas/Gadau
description: Itas/Gadau is a Local Government Area of Bauchi State, Nigeria. Its headquarters are in the town of Itas Itesiwaju. The town of Gadau is in the east of the area at 11°50′08″N 10°10′02″E.

name: Zaki
description: Zaki is a Local Government Area of Bauchi State, Nigeria. Its headquarters are in the town of Katagum.

name: Gamawa
description: Gamawa is a Local Government Area of Bauchi State, Nigeria, bordering Yobe State in the east. Its headquarters are in the town of Gamawa.

name: Damban
description: Dambam is a Local Government Area of Bauchi State, Nigeria. Its headquarters are in the town of Dambam. It has two district Dagauda and Jalam
